DOC.brief_summary: Patients schedule undergo total knee arthroplasty receive motor spar knee block continuous adductor canal block along multimodal analgesia start pre-operatively continued postoperative period . The study evaluate feasibility home discharge within first 24 hour follow total knee arthroplasty . We also evaluate pain score first 5 day follow surgery , cause delayed discharge adverse event .
DOC.brief_title: Ambulatory Continuous Adductor Canal Block Facilitate Same Day Discharge Following Total Knee Arthroplasty : A Pilot Study
DOC.criteria: 1 . Male female 4070years age 2 . Scheduled undergo unilateral primary total knee arthroplasty 3 . ASA Class I , II 1 . ASA 3 , 4 2 . Revision surgery 3 . Narcotic dependent ( opioid intake morphine equivalent > 10 mg/ day 3 month ) 4 . Other source chronic pain like fibromyalgia 5 . Patients associated significant cardiac , CNS respiratory disease ( poor cardiorespiratory reserve ) 6 . Major conduction defect EKG ( bifascilular block , CHB ) ; significant valvular heart disease 7 . Recent MI/ Stroke/ CHF ( past 3 month ) 8 . BMI > 35 9 . Obstructive sleep apnea ( AHI > 15 ) 10 . Patients coexist hematological disorder derange coagulation parameter . 11 . Patients preexist major organ dysfunction hepatic renal failure . 12 . Psychiatric illnesses 13 . Uncontrolled diabetes mellitus 14 . Lack informed consent . 15 . Allergy drug use study 16 . Preoperative neurological deficit 17 . Use walk aid preoperatively 18 . Living alone ( Lack Chaperone/home help ) 19 . Language barrier 20 . Contralateral leg weakness 21 . Pregnancy
